data.求人内容:
[Laboratory]
Laboratory for Marmoset Neural Architecture（Laboratory Head：Hideyuki Okano）

[Research Field]
The Marmoset Brain Architecture Project, a collaborative effort between professors Partha P Mitra (CSHL) and Hideyuki Okano (Riken BSI) aims to obtain a mesoscale connectivity map of the whole marmoset brain, using methods that have been previously successfully applied in the mouse http://mouse.brainarchitecture.org. This ambitious project will be the first time such a comprehensive mapping attempt has been made for a primate brain, using tracer injections placed on a systematic grid, followed by histological processing, and digital imaging of the entire brain at light microscope resolution. The data set will be subjected to computational neuroanatomical analysis.

[Job title and Job description]
1 Technical Staff

Role Summary/Purpose: The successful candidate will participate in a variety of basic and applied research in a high-throughput histology pipeline dedicated to the marmoset brain. Candidates will possess experience with basic laboratory practices and some or many aspects of the following: small animal handling, cryostat sectioning, histological or immunochemical tissue staining, brightfield and fluorescent microscopy, mechanical or electrical engineering, or willingness and ability to apply engineering concepts to a laboratory setting. Knowledge of histology or neuroanatomy is highly desirable.

Essential Responsibilities: Work with neuroanatomical tracer-injected marmoset brains, as part of a larger study.
The position will involve cryostat sectioning, slide-mounting, and digital imaging of histologically stained tissue.
Assist technicians, laboratory manager, and scientists in complex data gathering and analysis in the high-throughput tissue pipeline.
Work as a member of the laboratory and local team to provide efficient, daily output.
Document all experimental work and submit reports or summaries according to schedule.
Ensure proper care of all laboratory equipment.
Enhance and maintain technical knowledge of current standards, codes, and procedures regarding effective and safe use of all medical and scientific equipment, through formal instruction.
Responsibilities will also include general laboratory organization and maintenance of record and supplies databases.

[Work location]
RIKEN Brain Science Institute (2-1 Hirosawa, Wako, Saitama, Japan) is located in greater Tokyo area, about 30 min from the center of the city by train.

[Start of Employment]
Negotiable
